alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 16 at 4:39AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST/NOON MDT/ THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Dry Beaver Creek. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM MST Thursday /noon MDT Thursday/. * IMPACTS...Further rises in the water levels of already flooded creeks and normally dry washes. Deadly flooding over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 435 AM MST /535 AM MDT/, gauge reports indicated that Dry Beaver Creek had crested, however flow remains elevated due to earlier heavy rain and snowmelt. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Dry Beaver Creek, Rattlesnake Canyon, Beaver Creek and Jacks Canyon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mcguireville and Montezuma Castle National Monument. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away! The banks of creeks and washes are unstable and unsafe during any flooding event. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
